dialog: Hello Medi, I have trouble breathing and coughing uncontrollably.
Alright, based on your symptoms, it may be related to asthma.
Can you explain more about asthma?
Asthma is a chronic respiratory condition that can cause difficulty breathing, coughing, and wheezing.
What are the usual treatments for asthma?
Common treatments include inhalers, steroids, and avoidance of triggers.
What if the usual treatments don't work?
In cases where the usual treatments don't work, there are other treatment options available such as biological medications.
What are biological medications?
knowledge: Asthma Asthma  There is negative skin test to common inhalant allergens.  Often it starts later in life, and women are more commonly affected than men.  Usual treatments may not work as well.  The concept that "non-atopic" is synonymous with "non-allergic" is called into question by epidemiological data that the prevalence of asthma is closely related to the serum IgE level standardized for age and sex , indicating that asthma is almost always associated with some sort of IgE-related reaction and therefore has an allergic basis, although not all the allergic stimuli that cause asthma appear to have been included in the battery of aeroallergens studied " hypothesis).  For example, an updated systematic review and meta-analysis of population-attributable risk  of Chlamydia pneumoniae biomarkers in chronic asthma found that the PAR for C.  pneumoniae-specific IgE was 47%. When queried, asthma patients may report that their first asthma symptoms began after an acute lower respiratory tract illness Asthma Asthma
response: Biological medications are a newer class of medications that target specific proteins in the body's immune system to help control asthma symptoms.

dialog: Hi Medi, can you tell me more about the negative skin test to common inhalant allergens?
A negative skin test to common inhalant allergens means that the patient tested negative for any allergies to these common allergens.
Why might someone who doesn't have allergies still develop asthma?
There is a strong correlation between asthma and allergies, but not all cases of asthma are caused by allergies. Environmental factors, genetics, and other factors can also play a role.
Are women more likely to develop asthma?
Yes, women are more commonly affected by asthma than men.
Is it possible to develop asthma later in life?
Yes, it is possible to develop asthma later in life, even if you haven't had any previous respiratory issues.
What are some common triggers for asthma?

For example, an updated systematic review and meta-analysis of population-attributable risk  of Chlamydia pneumoniae biomarkers in chronic asthma found that the PAR for C.  pneumoniae-specific IgE was 47%. When queried, asthma patients may report that their first asthma symptoms began after an acute lower respiratory tract illness Asthma Asthma
response: Common triggers for asthma include allergies, exercise, cold air, and respiratory infections.

dialog: Hi Medi, I recently had a medical procedure done related to my asthma. Do you have any lifestyle advice for me?
Sure, what did the procedure involve?
I had a bronchoscopy done.
After a bronchoscopy, it's important to follow your doctor's specific instructions, but in general, it's important to avoid smoking, get plenty of rest, and stay hydrated.
Are there any exercises that can help improve my asthma?
Yes, certain breathing exercises like pursed lip breathing and diaphragmatic breathing can help improve asthma symptoms.
What about diet?
Maintaining a healthy, balanced diet with plenty of fruits, vegetables, and lean protein can also help improve asthma symptoms.
Thank you, Medi. Is there anything else I should be aware of?

dialog: Hi Medi, can you explain what asthma is?
Of course, asthma is a chronic respiratory disease that makes it hard to breathe. It causes inflammation and narrowing of the airways.
What are some symptoms of asthma?
Common symptoms include coughing, wheezing, shortness of breath, and chest tightness.
Is there a cure for asthma?
No, there is no cure for asthma, but it can be managed with proper treatment.
What kind of treatments are available?
Treatments include inhaled medications to reduce inflammation and relax the airways, as well as oral medications for more severe cases. Avoiding triggers and regular exercise can also help.
Thank you, Medi. Can asthma be fatal?
knowledge: Asthma Asthma There is negative skin test to common inhalant allergens. Often it starts later in life, and women are more commonly affected than men. Usual treatments may not work as well. For example, an updated systematic review and meta-analysis of population-attributable risk of Chlamydia pneumoniae biomarkers in chronic asthma found that the PAR for C. pneumoniae-specific IgE was 47%. When queried, asthma patients may report that their first asthma symptoms began after an acute lower respiratory tract illness Asthma Asthma
response: In rare cases, asthma can be fatal. It's important to seek prompt medical attention if you have severe symptoms.

dialog: Hi Medi, I have a question about allergies.
Sure, ask away.
What is the difference between an allergy and a cold?
Allergies are a reaction to something that triggers the immune system, while a cold is caused by a virus.
How can I tell the difference between the two?
Allergies usually cause itching, while a cold usually causes a sore throat.
What kind of things can trigger allergies?
Common triggers include pollen, dust, and animal dander.
Is there anything I can do to prevent allergies?
knowledge: Allergies Allergies An allergy is an immune system response to a foreign substance that's not typically harmful to your body. These foreign substances are called allergens. They can include certain foods, pollen, or pet dander, among other things. When you come into contact with an allergen, your body releases histamine, which can cause symptoms like itching, sneezing, and coughing. Allergies can be managed with medication or by avoiding triggers. Allergy shots are another option that can reduce the severity of reactions over time. Allergies Allergies
response: You can try to avoid triggers like pollen or dust, and consider taking medication like antihistamines or nasal sprays to manage symptoms.

dialog: Hey Medi, I just had a pulmonary function test and I'm not sure what the results mean.
I can help you understand the results. What did the test show?
It said my FEV1 was 80% of predicted and my FVC was 90% of predicted.

FEV1 stands for forced expiratory volume in one second, and FVC stands for forced vital capacity. Both of these are measures of lung function. Your results suggest that your lung function is slightly reduced, but still within a normal range.
What kind of lifestyle changes can I make to improve my lung function?
You can try to quit smoking if you're a smoker, and try to exercise regularly. There are also medications that can help improve lung function.
What kind of medications?
Bronchodilators are a common medication used to improve lung function. There are also inhaled corticosteroids that can help reduce inflammation in the airways.
And is there anything else I should be doing to take care of my lungs?

dialog: Hi Medi, I just had a medical procedure for my asthma. Can you give me some advice for my lifestyle?
Of course, after a medical procedure, it's important to take it easy and rest for a few days. Avoid any strenuous physical activity.
What kind of exercise should I do after the procedure?
It's important to consult with your doctor before starting any exercise routine, but typically low-impact exercises like walking, yoga, or swimming are recommended for asthma patients.
What about my diet?
A healthy, balanced diet is important for everyone, but especially for asthma patients. Try to eat more fruits and vegetables, and avoid processed foods or foods high in sugar and salt.
Thanks for the advice, Medi. Can you recommend any specific foods or vitamins that are good for asthma?

Sure, foods rich in magnesium like spinach, almonds, and avocado can help relax the muscles around the airways. Vitamin D is also important for lung health, and can be found in fatty fish, egg yolks, and mushrooms.
Thanks, Medi. I appreciate your help.
knowledge: Asthma Asthma There is negative skin test to common inhalant allergens.  Often it starts later in life, and women are more commonly affected than men.  Usual treatments may not work as well.  The concept that 'non-atopic' is synonymous with 'non-allergic' is called into question by epidemiological data that the prevalence of asthma is closely related to the serum IgE level standardized for age and sex, indicating that asthma is almost always associated with some sort of IgE-related reaction and therefore has an allergic basis, although not all the allergic stimuli that cause asthma appear to have been included in the battery of aeroallergens studied 'hypothesis). For example, an updated systematic review and meta-analysis of population-attributable risk of Chlamydia pneumoniae biomarkers in chronic asthma found that the PAR for C. pneumoniae-specific IgE was 47%. When queried, asthma patients may report that their first asthma symptoms began after an acute lower respiratory tract illness Asthma Asthma

The usual treatments are inhalers and sometimes steroids. However, for some people, these treatments may not work well

dialog: Hi Medi, I have some questions about asthma
Sure, what do you want to know?
Is asthma more common in women than men?
Yes, asthma is more commonly affected women than men
What are the common triggers for asthma?
The common triggers are exercise, cold air, stress, allergens, irritants, and infections
Can asthma be cured?
There is no cure for asthma, but it can be managed with medications and avoidance of triggers
Thank you, Medi. Is there any concern if asthma is left untreated?

dialog: Hi Medi, I just had a medical procedure for my asthma. Do you have any advice?
Of course, what kind of procedure did you have?
I had a bronchial thermoplasty
After bronchial thermoplasty, it's important to follow your doctor's instructions, including taking your medications as prescribed
Are there any lifestyle changes I can make to improve my asthma?
Yes, you can try to maintain a healthy weight, avoid smoking and second-hand smoke, and avoid triggers that can make your asthma worse. Regular exercise can also help improve your asthma control
Thank you, Medi. Can you tell me more about bronchial thermoplasty?
Bronchial thermoplasty is a procedure that uses heat to reduce the amount of smooth muscle in the airways. This can help reduce the frequency and severity of asthma attacks
I see. Thank you for your help, Medi
